item.title: Mardi add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Niall had been able to mask the odor of fairy from Eric in the restaurant, but I saw from the flare of Eric's nostrils that the intoxicating scent clung to me. Eric's eyes closed in ecstasy, and he actually licked his lips. I felt like a T-bone just out of reach of a hungry dog. "Snap out of it," I said. I wasn't in the mood. With a huge effort, Eric reigned himself in. "When you smell like that," he said, "I just wanna fuck you and bite you and rub myself all over you." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Mardi add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Believe in angels? Then believe in vampires. Believe in me. There are worse things on earth." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Mardi add a quote by Franz McLaren
item.description: "Life without a Kindle is like life without a library nearby." -- Franz McLaren

item.title: Mardi add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Lovers of print are simply confusing the plate for the food." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Mardi add a quote by J.A. Konrath
item.description:
"Back in August, I wrote a post about the supposed race to the bottom with ebooks, refuting some nonsense written by an establishment bonehead.
This meme won't die. People are still convinced that new ebooks are going to be priced at ten cents, and writers will starve, and this will cause a second Great Depression where banks will close and people will be forced to buy Kindles with food stamps, and then the earth will enter another ice age where all the bunnies will freeze to death." -- J.A. Konrath

item.title: Mardi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mardi add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath
